newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: NORMANS SEES GROWTH AFTER PROFIT TURNAROUND.
newsitem.headline: NORMANS SEES GROWTH AFTER PROFIT TURNAROUND.

text.p: Australian wine producer Normans Wines Ltd said on Thursday it now had the building blocks in place for future growth, following a A$1.1 million turnaround which returned the company to profitability in 1996/97.
Normans recorded an after-tax profit of A$235,000 for the year to June 30, 1997, compared to a loss of A$867,000 in 1995/96.
Turnover rose 48 percent to A$31 million from A$21 million.

"Normans is now excellently positioned to meet the challenge of maintaining its momentum in production and marketing, thereby ensuring the company can play an increasingly important role in the Australian wine industry," chairman Lionel Krongold said.

Krongold said in a statement Normans produced more than 10 million litres of wine in 1996/97 and its 1996 vintage grape crush of 13,5000 tonnes had surpassed forecasts, with the company anticipating a 50 percent lift in the 1998 crush.

Following a rights issue which raised A$3.5 million earlier this year, the company had embarked on a major spending program to increase capacity at its two wineries by 50 percent to set the scene for increasing production volumes by 2000, he said.
Normans shares were 10 cents firmer at A$1.05 at 1.50 p.m. (0350 GMT).
